title: Flight of the double sunrise
snippet: "One more wild goose chase," that's what Dil, my boss said when she reluctantly agreed to accompany me to the southern fringe of Sri Lanka, in search of Justin and his memories of aeroplanes that flew to break records.

title: Environmental Conservation Zone to be designated along Kelani River
snippet: The Environment Ministry is to designate an Environmental Conservation Zone along the Kelani River from Hanwella to Peliyagoda, the Ministry said in a press release yesterday. Environment Minister Mahinda Amaraweera has instructed the Central Environmental Authority (CEA) to mark the protected boundaries of all rivers as a measure to protect them from environmental pollution.

title: UN Ambassador on Climate Change praises Lanka for initiatives already taken
snippet: By Ifham Nizam Sri Lanka is the best in South Asia as regards efforts being made to mitigate the effects of the climate emergency, Ken O'Flaherty, says Ambassador for Asia-Pacific and the South Asia Region at the United Nations Office for Climate Change (COP26).

title: Teejay Lanka 3-month group revenue up 119% to Rs. 10.4 billion
snippet: Teejay Lanka PLC has made an encouraging start to FY 2021-22 with solid top and bottom line growth in the three months ending 30th June 2021, shrugging off the pandemic-imposed shackles that retarded Q1 growth last year and overcoming the impact of the third wave of COVID-19 on the industry.

title: On What Conditions should Teachers on the Street be Allowed Back in the Classroom?

title: Sri Lanka private borrowings surge to Rs83bn in June, CB credit Rs124bn
snippet: Sri Lanka's private credit surged by 83 billion rupees in June 2021, while credit to government surged 170 billion rupees, of which 124 billion rupees were printed, official data showed.

snippet: Taking into consideration the national need of the hour SriLankan Airlines has uplifted another batch of Sinopharm vaccines amounting to 4 million doses to the country on three dedicated cargo flights.

title: Hayleys Fabric doubles revenues in June after debt funded acquisition of South Asia Textiles
snippet: Filing its first set of consolidated interim financial statements for the three months ending June since acquiring South Asia Textiles Limited, Hayleys Fabric PLC doubled its revenues and nearly tripled its earnings in a sign that the combined entity is adding scale into its knit fabric making business with synergies being generated along its way.

title: Higher loss provisions and other expenses weigh on DFCC Bank 2Q

title: People get vaccinated in Sri Lanka, as Delta variant spreads amid 3rd wave
snippet: People lined up to get vaccinated in Sri Lanka in the midst of a third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, with medical officials warning that the Delta variant may be spreading beyond control. The country's Health Ministry on Sunday received a new batch of Sinopharm vaccine from China as a mass scale vaccination program against the COVID-19 is underway in the country.

title: Sri Lanka Coronavirus vaccinates 50-pct of population with one dose, 13.4-pct two doses
snippet: Sri Lanka has vaccinated 50.5 percent of the population or 11.08 million persons with the one dose of Coronavirus vaccine with 40 percent coming from Sinopharm and 13.4 percent with a second dose.

title: Teachers, Principals must be notified about today's cabinet decision: Joseph Stalin

title: Contractors who powered US war in Afghanistan stuck in Dubai
snippet: Some of the foreign contractors who powered the logistics of America's "forever war" in Afghanistan now find themselves stranded on an unending layover in Dubai without a way to get home.

title: Sri Lanka: Their Master's Voice
